content:
That sounds like a great approach! Prioritizing your close friends and inviting a few social friends who you've been meaning to catch up with will help create a warm and intimate atmosphere. And, by considering the purpose of the dinner party and being mindful of the number of guests, you'll be able to manage the event with ease.

Remember, the key is to be intentional with your guest list and focus on inviting people who will appreciate the effort you're putting into hosting a dinner party. Don't be afraid to keep the guest list small and intimate, especially if this is your first dinner party.

Also, don't forget to have fun and be present during the event! Enjoy the company of your friends, and take time to relax and socialize. Remember, it's okay to ask for help if you need it, and don't stress too much about the details.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. I'm here to help. Good luck with your dinner party planning, and I hope you have a wonderful time with your friends!
